sentences.sContent: the cheapest TV on the market
sentences.sCn: 市场上最便宜的电视机

sentences.sContent: Property is cheaper in Spain than here.
sentences.sCn: 西班牙的房地产比这里便宜。

sentences.sContent: a cheap shop (= one that sells goods cheaply )
The equipment is relatively cheap and simple to use.
sentences.sCn: 这种设备相对比较便宜，而且操作简单。

sentences.sContent: This coat was dirt cheap (= very cheap – an informal expression 非正式用语 ) .
...making them relatively cheap and easy to install...
...the company may still be cursing its decision to promote cheap choices over more expensive ones because items on its "value menu" now account for around 20% of all sales...
...cheap meals like Big Macs and Whoppers become even more attractive...
...Traffic was boosted in America, the home of fast food, with discounts and promotions, such as $1 menus and cheap combination meals...
...the health and safety of children should probably come before cheap service...
...excessive packaging can make the majority of merchants get high profit for the cheap commodity by improving price...

synos.tran: [贸易]便宜的；小气的；不值钱的

phrases.pCn: [口]觉得身体不舒服；感到惭愧
低利借款；来得容易的非正当收入；在钱上好商量的人

trans.tranOther: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected
